credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Mantlepiece and dado for room in the Villa Digne
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
description: Horizontal rectangle. The lower part is a variation of the scheme of -1522. The supports consist of fluted consoles upon which two children are seated besdie a flower pot in front of a shell at right. Half of a similar motif is uon the support at left. A landscape with a Doric temple in ruins and pyramids are shown. The upper part suggests an ovoidal painting in rich framing. At right is an imaginary arch double the width of that at left.
name: Drawing
